channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Trip hazard telephone manhole cover on pavement., 17th January
item.description:
Between 39 and 41 Parton Road, Churchdown. The telephone manhole cover has not been pushed down properly, is raised and is a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Parton Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Standing water on road in Hucclecourt bypass, 17th January
item.description:
Standing water on road in Hucclecourt bypass - it is so bad it makes all drivers go into the outside lane which is supposed to be for right turns
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockworth Bypass, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury

item.title: Smashed glass all over skate park, 17th January
item.description:
The skatepark is covered in broken glass from several glass bottles. There is also significant amounts of racist graffiti on the ramps too!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Lane, Brockworth, Gloucester

item.title: Deep pothole, 17th January
item.description:
This pothole was repaired last on 17th November 2025 ( ref. 22090642).Repir was poor in past year. This area has been done more than 15 times. localised repair is not suitable, whole larger area should have been repaired.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold

item.title: Continued parking on double yellow lines, 17th January
item.description:
A van keeps parking on the double yellow lines at the bottom end of Alexandra Street. Despite reporting this on many occasions, nothing has been done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Alexandra Street, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged road surface, 17th January
item.description:
The whole of Swindon Lane, Cheltenham, between the Racecourse and Windyridge Road, road surface is in a terrible state of repair with pot holes constantly appearing and reappearing. May I request a thorough inspection with a view to scheduling a full surface removal and relaying. That road is used expensively, including busses lorries and by race traffic. It is a particular danger to cyclists - especially now, trying to get to the new green cycle paths.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Swindon Lane, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole, 17th January
item.description:
Church Road, Leckhampton outside Beverston. I think this pothole is deeper than a tennis ball so I have reported it to the Emergency Number. I have entered in into this website so I can upload pictures showing the location and the state of the pothole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury

item.title: It was dark so couldn't see the pothole on unlit road. Felt very deep though. Before railway bridge heading along Badgeworth road from Churchdown towards the Reddings, 17th January
item.description:
Before railway bridge on Badgeworth Rd heading from Churchdown. I had no idea it was there as it was dark. I do know there have been potholes along that stretch of road for months though.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
